N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1025.5 - Loading limitations and restrictions-acids

State Regulations
(a) When acids or other corrosive liquids and
flammable solids or oxidizing materials are transported in the same vehicle at
the same time, neither commodity may be loaded above or adjacent to the
other. (b) Nitric acid, when loaded
in the same vehicle with other acids or other corrosive liquids in carboys, must be separated from the other carboys. A two-inch by six-inch plank, set on
edge, shall be nailed across the floor of the vehicle at least 12 inches from
the nitric acid carboys, and the space between the plank and the carboys of
nitric acid shall be filled with sand, sifted ashes, or other incombustible
absorbent material. (c) Acids or
other corrosive liquids must not be loaded in the same vehicle with cyanide or
cyanide mixtures (class B poison). Notes
